column1: Will Chinese businessman Jack Ma physically appear in public outside of the People's Republic of China (PRC) before 1 April 2021?
column6: ['Business', 'Technology']
Very unlikely that Jack Ma will physically appear in public. With two days left until April 1st it is very unlikely, but not impossible that Jack Ma will reappear.
No need to physically appear. Also, bad time to travel: Covid.

As per a report in BBC, je was last spotted in the Chinese island of Hainan. It means he is in China and is keeping a low profile. Hence, there are very little chances to appear in public outside of China. https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-56448688

This considered, your stakeholders may want to consider crafting a similar question about China's "new richest man" ...Zhong Shanshan... richer than Warren Buffet, and considered to be a "lone wolf"..... link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhong_Shanshan
There is no indication that Jack Ma will appear public outside of People's Republic of China before April 1st, 2021.
Passage of time
https://www.ft.com/content/784fb680-3e58-4c7a-a375-2f78fad52c64

Although Ma has been avoiding the public eye since speaking out against the Chinese government in October 2020, he has recently made a speaking appearance on January 20th, 2021, along with being spotted golfing on Hainan (Chinese island) within two weeks following the former appearance. With Ma seeming to continue lying low, while also having two appearances within China early this year, I predict that he will continue on as usual, maybe with a few more appearances within the PRC, with no plans to flee to Singapore, as some have suggested, and with very little possibility of being seen outside of the PRC.
He may appear internally, but not outside of PRC.

Jack Ma has recently been in conflict with the Chinese Government after being critical of Chinese regulators. As the description states above Jack Ma isn't missing but is "laying low". His company Ant has come under fire recently after Chinese regulators found that it undermined China's own banking system. This reinvigorated any fire that was to die. Therefore realistically Jack Ma will continue to "lay low" and the probability that he will make a public appearance is slim.
Prior estimate was likely over confident
There are chances that he will appear in public but within the country first.

First, Jack Ma is not 'missing'. In his video speech, he said that he was contemplating about the role of private firms in poverty alleviation. Two weeks later, his company received commendations from the premier for its role in poverty alleviation. Connecting these together, there is a gradual return of goodwill. Hence, there is a good chance for Jack Ma to appear in public.
Laplace's law gives a ~30%, but we are not in a Laplace law regime.

Bloomberg 2/10 - Jack Ma working on his golf game in China. "The co-founder of Ant Group Co. and Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. teed off in recent weeks at the Sun Valley Golf Resort, a secluded 27-hole course on the Chinese island of Hainan, people familiar with the matter said, asking not to be identified discussing private information. Located near the island’s southern tip, the course offers expansive greens and stunning views."
I'm lowering my forecast to 5%, after reviewing an article shared by @hoosier2020.
Revised probability after rereading the question. I missed the "outside the PRC." Thanks, @BeepBoop
Unlikely that China will let him out in the near future as he might not want to return.

Jack Ma and Ant Group, his Alibaba-offshoot payment processing firm have run afoul of the CCP's one rule: don't threaten the Chinese Communist Party's monopoly on political power. Past disappearances from public life by prominent figures usually end up the same way: a reappearance in public after many weeks or months with abject confessions and apologies by the prominent person, followed by enormous fines or a jail sentence or both. Jack Ma's attempts to move into financial services with his already gigantic market dominance with Alipay and his outspoken criticism of the CCP have likely cost him the ability to make Ant Group anything other than a payment processing firm due to the antitrust investigation launched as Ma disappeared from public.[1] His criticism of the CCP's monopoly on political power will likely be even more catastrophic for Ma personally in terms of his wallet and personal freedom.

with 2 months left, I think it's highly unlikely. There is a track record of what happens to high level individuals that speak out against the CCP. If he isn't missing and truly is 'laying low', then he'll continue to do so for the foreseeable future.

Decreasing my forecast since the Chinese government is applying further pressure to Jack Ma by more tightly regulating Alibaba. It is unlikely that Jack Ma will get back in the CCP's good graces in the next two months.

Poor Jack no. He's not going to pull a Nissan founder type escape. Never. Also, appear in public - ah, you include HK and Macau - it maybe the doesn't appear period. Online vs. to be seen alive? Tough being wealthy in a "Communist" country... lol
Spoke out against Chinese gov't's regulation and hasn't appeared since.
Twenty-eight days in quarantine will cost him a lot of money
It is likely that the CCP will not allow Jack Ma to travel for a period of time and he will not take extreme efforts to leave the country. The CCP takes criticism from public figures very seriously.
The government will likely be keeping him close at hand to better monitor his recent reeducation regime.
Considering travel is going to be lower (and less necessary) than usual, along with Ma's political troubles, seems to make it rather unlikely - not impossible, though.
Beijing just gave him an new leash, and it is a short one.
China is likely to allow that to mend its image in a post Trump world order

He was seen on video last week (the day before this question was posted) according to Bloomberg: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-28/alibaba-to-face-investors-amid-crackdown-on-jack-ma-s-empire. It is extremely likely that he will be on video again in the next few months.

The recent video may have confirmed he’s still around, and the assumption is that the video was taken somewhere in China. So if he is there unless he hides in a suitcase like Ghosn it’s unlikely he will be travelling outside the country in these COVID times by April, even if he is free to make that choice. Given all the restructuring going on too, it’s not clear he should be away at the moment. I suspect there is a lot of handing over of power from him to others going on in the background that the restructuring is making public.
Xi will permit it
They showed him back but he isnt the richest anymore

he has been allowed to appear speak, he is obviously paying party line price, but after trump they cannot be seen to "disappear" financial figures, have always played a hand in markets but cannot be seen to be manipulating and recent statement re: Ant demonstrates, he will be quieter but will appear and Chinese market/IPO's/capital investment and economy will grow.
For public perception reasons
Pigs might fly. A snowball may not melt in the pits of Hell, and Mr. Ma may make a public appearance outside the PRC.
he ticked off the wrong people
Cutting my forecast to zero, given the time remaining in this question.

Absolutely not - Travel restrictions due to COVID - He will be monitored continuously by both press and Gov. - He still has too much to lose before he becomes a flight risk. There are major pushes to restructure the might of monopolies and Big Tech Too Big Too Fail-issues. Some reasons might be petty for his criticism, but it is by far not the only factor why he's being scrutinized. Big odds that he ends up as a massive billionaire, owning slightly smaller, clipped unicorn companies...

Between the Chinese govt restriction on travel placed on Jack Ma and COVID travel restrictions that won't be loosened before April, 2021 there is virtually no chance that he will appear outside the PRC.

It seems unlikely that Mr. Ma will appear in public outside of the PRC by 1 April due to other cases that are similar in nature to this one. Specifically, Fan BingBing was a public figure that broke Chinese law and dissapeared from public view for 3 months in 2018, and did not make a public appearance until April, 2019 [1]. Mr. Ma's trajectory seems to be following a similar flight path as he dissapeared from the public eye in October of 2020, and just released a video earlier this month [2].
It depends on what you consider the PRC is. Does Hong Kong and Taiwan count? Hmmm. Does it really matter? If he appears anywhere?

The inference from the press reports that Jack Ma gave a critical speech straight after a speech by Wang Qishan (right hand man of Xi Jinping) that offered a contrary view that insisted that business did not rule the state (especially the Communist Party). Ma accused the communist regulators od stifling innovation, but Xi Jinping is leaning to the Leninist view where businesses and groups must align with the Party. The result being that the Company’s IPO was pulled. His first public appearance in three months, it had similarities to a hostage video including the down-dressing with a navy pullover in a grey room and a commentary on entrepreneurs devoting time to ‘rural revitalisation and common prosperity’. This brings to mind the cultural revolution where academics and students were sent to rural areas (that did have an effect on education in those poor areas). That situation and the current one being experienced by Ma shows a willingness to humble the miscreant and the resultant loss of face.
Maybe he will appear in public after September 2021.
He was out of public view for 3 months last time. Now he has to emerge in next 3 months and be outside of China, Hong Kong and Macau. Pandemic is a huge factor. Not going to happen.

1. COVID conditions = all international travel is dampened, including Ma's. 2. As @fish_n_chips pointed out, pattern of suppression of high-vis figures after they criticize the CCP. I need to do a little more research to figure out exactly how long the average is, historically. 3. Ma has lost 13% of his net worth since the debacle in October. I think he's going to play by the CCP rules in order to maximize chances that he can resume normalcy and regain his wealth.
I am convinced by the rationals of @SE_Meyer (an experienced forecaster) and @fish_n_chips

With the pandemic, travel restrictions, and his scuffle with the CCP, it seems unlikely. The phrasing "physically appear in public" is hard to parse, however; does this mean at a public speaking event or is it sufficient to be caught by paparazzis travelling in a car caravan? The chance of him leaving China/HK/Macau for non-public business events strikes me as much higher than attending a public event, for obvious reasons.

China, in its efforts to restrain the introduction of virus mutations to mainland China and Hong Kong, will have tough travel restrictions with the rest of the world until at least April 2021 - even for top-level management and corporate travel. There are some experts who say that the Brazilian mutation could lower the efficacy of vaccines ("immunization escape") AND is more transmissible, and must thus be treated like a completely new virus/pandemic.
There is a low possibility that Jack Ma physically appears in public outside of the PRC for a few reasons:
IPO squashed. Ma Yum advised to not leave China. Not seen since October. Unless something changes, outside China appearance appears unlikely.
China government worried that business leaders are becoming too powerful.

https://www.ibtimes.sg/china-ccp-nationalize-jack-mas-alibaba-ant-group-54444 Jack Ma has grown too powerful for the CCP's comfort. They will break up his company and likely keep him close in order to remind him and others who is in charge
Assuming he is able to get out of the country. Yes.

@Econja2018 captured it nicely with the Hotel California reference, but I think there are too many moving parts to this issue to go all the way to zero just yet. I am probably being unduly cautious, though. One never likes to go up against The Eagles.

This is a short time frame question, the best kind. Apparently Mr. Ma expressed his views to too many too forcefully and may now lose some of his mojo and some of his businesses. My guess, based on no data, is that he will continue to lie low until his empire is partly dismembered at which time he may be seen outside the PRC again.
It's like the hotel California, you can check out anytime you want but you just can't leave.
